Name: Tanagra-Style Terra-Cotta of Young Girl
Description: The statue depicts a bare-headed young girl wearing a blue chiton, or knee-length garment, and pink himation, a rectangular cloth draped over the left shoulder and about the body. The beautiful statue was made from Tanagra clay. The hairstyle consists of simple tresses twisting at the back of the head. The Tanagra statues are distinguished by a diversity of shapes, portraying ladies in general. They stand in a posture usually seen in statues of philosophers, especially Sophocles, where the body weight is supported on one leg while the other leg is slightly bent.
